alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 21 at 3:56AM MDT until October 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM MDT SUNDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches below 7000 feet, except 8 to 14 inches across ridge tops and passes. Locally higher totals in excess of 14 inches above 9000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Caribou Range and Bear River Range including Emigration Summit. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times, especially over mountain passes where blowing snow is possible. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Backcountry enthusiasts and hunters should be prepared for wintry conditions and the potential for hypothermia if caught in a storm unprepared.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
